steps.title: Make sure your headset is charged before pairing.
steps.content: Make sure your headset is charged before pairing. Depending on your headset model, the power light should be lighting up solidly—meaning it’s lit up but not flashing—when the headset is fully charged. Depending on the model of your Plantronics headset, you will hear a single tone every 15 seconds if it’s on low battery, or the power indicator will flash.

steps.title: There are a number of ways to turn on a pair of Plantronics headset.
steps.content: There are a number of ways to turn on a pair of Plantronics headset. All require you to switch on the Power button, which is easy to identify. Either flip, press, or slide the button to the ON position.

steps.title: The way to enter Pairing mode depends on the headset model.
steps.content: The way to enter Pairing mode depends on the headset model. For example: If your headset has a single multi-function button, start with it off, then press and hold it for 5–6 seconds until the light start flashing. If your headset has a sliding On and Off switch, hold the call button for 5–6 seconds until the light starts flashing. For headsets with a On and Off button, start with the headset powered off and hold the Power button down for 5–6 seconds until the light starts flashing.

steps.title: Put your computer, phone, tablet, or other device into pairing mode.
steps.content: Put your computer, phone, tablet, or other device into pairing mode. Once your device is ready to pair, it will detect your Plantronics headset.

steps.title: Depending on your model, you may have to enter a pairing code.
steps.content: Depending on your model, you may have to enter a pairing code. If prompted, enter 0000 (four zeroes). Once your headset is paired, you'll be able to listen to music, make phone calls, and do other tasks with your new headset.
